content.title: End of DCI's attempts to control the Intelligence Community
content.text: Efforts were made to institute DCI control over the Intelligence Community, but they were eventually closed off by a series of sensational disclosures in the media.

content.title: Nixon's investigation into the Intelligence Community.
content.text: President Nixon directed Deputy Director of the Office of Management and Budget James Schlesinger on how organizational structure should be implemented from the Intelligence Community to bring about greater efficiency and effectiveness. They found that intelligence functions were fragmented, competitive and disorganized.

content.title: The Nixon directive
content.text: Refurbished the United States Intelligence Board for assisting the DCI. Also set up the Intelligence Committee 11 of the NSC to coordinate and to review intelligence activities.
